item.title: Best Stardust Farm in Shape of Dreams
item.description:
Stardust is the main meta currency in Shape of Dreams that lets players upgrade their characters outside their runs in the Rapids. By getting Stardust, players will be able to unlock new Constellation Stars to make their characters stronger, and later on, this resource can be spent to purchase Memories and Essences even before a run begins.

Players will naturally earn Stardust as they play Shape of Dreams, but if you want to get as much as possible within a short amount of time, there are a few ways to do so. This guide covers three different Stardust farming strategies, including one that will work even for newer players.

Beginner Stardust Farm in Shape of Dreams

If you've just started playing the game, then one way you can efficiently farm for Stardust is to use Mist and rush the first boss over and over again . You can do this with any character, but among the ones new players start out with, Mist tends to be the fastest and most consistent in terms of overall performance.

Beat the boss, grab the Stardust drops, then quit to the main menu. Stardust is credited as soon as you pick it up, so you don't have to worry about dying or resetting runs.

The reason why Mist is so good is because of her passive, Astrid's Masterpiece - En Garde. This causes her first three attacks against an enemy to deal more damage and generate a Barrier for her . To make the most out of this, use the following skills and Constellation Stars:

  • Fleche (Skill): Dash toward a target, dealing damage and hitting them immediately after with a basic attack. This temporarily increases Mist's movement speed, and if the target dies to Fleche, Mist heals and reduces Fleche's cooldown by a percentage.
  • Parry (Skill): Parry the first incoming instance of damage from the front within 0.6s of activating the skill, then launch a counterattack that hits up to five enemies. Targets that are hit by Parry's counterattack are stunned, take damage, and have Astrid's Masterwork's cooldown timer on them reset.
  • Astrid's Smithing (Red Constellation Star): Increases Attack Damage by up to 12.
  • Aggressive Stance (Red Constellation Star): Increases Attack Damage by up to 8.
  • Burning Bloodlust (Red Constellation Star): Increases Attack Damage by up to 16 until the end of the second world.
  • Charged Saber (Parry Augment): After parrying an attack, you gain a Barrier equal to 100% of the damage parried, and your next attack is a critical strike.

It may take a while before you can unlock all the skills needed to make this method as fast as possible, but as long as you're using Mist, you'll be able to unlock all of these while you're trying to farm Stardust.

If you don't want to use Mist, then do make sure to use either Burning Bloodlust or Awakened Magic to get a significant AD or AP boost in the beginning of the run. Which one of these you'll take depends on what build you want to use on which character. Mages like Yubar and Bismuth benefit more from AP than AD.

If you're strong or fast enough, you can reach and beat the first boss in 2-3 minutes , and if you're on Deep Sleep difficulty, you should get 18 Stardust per run, resulting in 360-540 Stardust per hour.

The Fireball Method

This one relies a lot on luck and the Deja Vu feature, which unlocks after you reach a cumulative 50 ranks across all Travelers in Shape of Dreams . The Deja Vu feature lets players purchase Memories and Essences before a run using Stardust. This may sound counterproductive, but the investment is worth it.

Before anything else, this method involves looping, making this a fairly time-consuming method.

This works on any character. The important thing is that you get the Essence of the Vortex. When equipped on any Memory, this Essence launches fireballs toward nearby enemies. The higher the Essence's quality, the faster it will shoot. You can equip the Beginner's Luck Constellation Star from the Imaginary Constellation to immediately start with a 130% Essence of the Vortex on your character.

You'll immediately be able to do tons of damage to normal mobs with Essence of the Vortex and your starting skills. As the run progresses, look for the following Essences:

  • . Essence of Lethality: Increases the damage you deal to targets with at least 70% health.
  • Essence of Adventure: Every time you enter a new room, a random Essence equipped to the Memory with Essence of Adventure will have its quality and Gold value upgraded.

Equip Adventure by itself into a Memory slot, then before you enter a new room, slot-in Vortex into the same Memory that Adventure is in. By doing this, Essence of the Vortex will scale for as long as you want. Meanwhile, Lethality will increase Vortex's damage to healthy targets, letting you one-shot them with the Vortex fireballs or with a quick follow-up using your own abilities.

The Black Market Imagination Star will let you refresh merchant inventories.

The Bismuth Long Run Method

Bismuth is extremely powerful with the right setup, and by using her, you can go on long runs that can rack you tons of Stardust. For this method, you will need:

  • Rank 15 Bismuth
  • Enlightenment (Unique Bismuth Destruction Star)
  • Umbral Edge (Memory)
  • High Attack Speed
  • High Ability Power

This Bismuth build is all about stacking as much Attack Speed as possible. She works well with Attack Speed because of her Prismatic Visions passive, which gives her an initial Attack Speed bump and makes her deal bonus magic damage with her basic attack. Unlike other characters in Shape of Dreams , Bismuth cannot use her basic attacks directly..

Spend all of your Dream Dust and upgrades on Prismatic Visions, and you'll eventually make Bismuth so powerful that you can just run through rooms recklessly.

Umbral Edge gives you bonus critical strike chance and Dark damage on your attacks. With how quickly Bismuth is going to attack with this setup, Umbral Edge is going to be the perfect support Memory. You can use whatever Memories you prefer for the rest of her slots, though anything that would make Bismuth's attacks stronger or faster is ideal.

For this build, you'll want to keep looping for as long as you can . Just keep repeating worlds until you decide that you've had enough Stardust for one run. Just run into a red circle or hope that something survives your damage for long enough. Otherwise, beat the final boss or just quit back to the main menu.

Shape of Dreams
MOBA
Hack and Slash
Action
Roguelike
Systems

September 11, 2025

item.title: Why You Shouldn't Hold Your Breath About This Pokemon Legends: Z-A DLC Rumor
item.description:
After Pokemon Sword and Shield set the standard for post-launch DLC in mainline Pokemon games, Pokemon Legends: Z-A has come out swinging by announcing upcoming content before the base game has even released. This has been met with some controversial opinions from fans, but many future players are excited because the trailer for the DLC, Mega Dimension, showcases tons of never-before-seen Mega Stones. It's not known yet how many Mega Evolutions will be added to the post-game content, and that's left fans to speculate widely about what each stone might mean.

So far, the only stones that have their Megas revealed, if all the stones reference new evolutions, are Raichu X and Y. Even against the controversy the DLC has kicked up, there's plenty of hope that players will get to see some of their favorite Pokemon Mega Evolve in Pokemon Legends: Z-A , even if it's in post-game content. Thanks to one particular stone that can be found in the trailer, plenty of fans are hoping that Mega Flygon will finally appear after being skipped when Mega Evolution was first introduced. Unfortunately, this likely isn't the case.

It's common for fans to look at the colors of Mega Evolution stones and make a guess of what creature they're made to represent, but one key detail gets missed in the excitement at times. Mega Stones typically showcase the colors of the Mega Evolution, rather than their base forms. This is highlighted in the Mega Dimension trailer itself with Mega Raichu X and Mega Raichu Y. Not only that, but Game Freak also tried to make Mega Flygon for Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire back in Generation 6, and scrapped the idea. The current hype around Mega Flygon is a perfect illustration of why.

How Mega Flygon Might Put Game Freak in a Pickle That Isn't Even Worth the Effort

When Pokemon X and Y introduced the Mega Evolution mechanic, the introduction of Mega Salamence quickly made fans speculate and request a similar form for the Dragon Pokemon's counterpart, Flygon. Because of this, Game Freak did consider the idea and came up with a few concepts. As fans already know, though, the form didn't come to pass, and it's purely due to fan expectations. Ken Sugimori himself has said that Flygon fit the Mega Evolution criteria, but no design was completed that felt like it would satisfy the sheer number of people desiring Mega Flygon even back then.

Now, the odds are likely even smaller for Mega Flygon than they were back in 2014. As part of the Game Freak Teraleak that happened roughly a year ago, it was revealed that at least a Flying-type Eevee evolution was scrapped for Pokemon Sun and Moon on the basis of being too similar to fan-made concepts. As upsetting as this information might be, it makes sense as Nintendo, Game Freak, or The Pokemon Company could find themselves in hot water if they design something too similar to a fan's work; it'd be hard to prove the similarities weren't on purpose, and the fan could sue for it.

Fans Should Leave Mega Flygon As an Unexpected Surprise Rather Than a Hyped-Up Hope

The hype behind Mega Flygon may indeed be the nail in the coffin that keeps it from happening. This expectation and desire have only grown since the last time Mega Evolution was featured prominently in the mainline games, and even now, the Mega Stone shown off in the Mega Dimension trailer has fueled the fire and led to more pleas and fan art around the concept. Of course, fans should always draw and create whatever they want, but the growth of this expectation might still leave the concept shelved to this day.

As a result, Pokemon Legends: Z-A players shouldn't expect to see Flygon anytime soon, as that Mega Stone could belong to almost any Pokemon at this stage. There's a lot stacked against Flygon in particular, so if it does show up, it'll be a big surprise as it's made it through against every single one of the odds. However, Mega Flygon remains a very loaded "if" rather than a guaranteed "when."

Pokemon Legends: Z-A

item.title: Marvel's Wolverine's Rumored Release Just Created a Golden Opportunity for Magic: The Gathering
item.description:
Rumors are flying all over the shop when it comes to the upcoming Marvel's Wolverine , a video game take on the famed X-Men character with Insomniac at the helm. However, one rumor in particular (if true) would see Marvel's Wolverine throw quite the bone to Magic: The Gathering .

Insomniac's Marvel's Wolverine game has been subject to a great deal of hype and speculation, and it's easy to see why. With Insomniac delivering a series of highly acclaimed Spider-Man titles for Sony, Marvel fans are waiting with bated breath to see where the company is taking the superhero genre next. The studio has been tight-lipped about its efforts with Wolverine , but that hasn't stopped leaks from pushing info to the forefront. Following the 2023 ransomware attack on Insomniac, more leaks and insider claims continue to trickle out about the much-anticipated title, and now its release window may be clear.

If Rumors Are True, Marvel's Wolverine Could Be A Boon To Magic The Gathering's Crossover Plans

A flurry of new Marvel 's Wolverine rumors have come out recently, many of which are pointing in the same few directions. Not only are there rumors claiming that Wolverine will release in 2026 (according to an anonymous source speaking to MP1st), but there are similar rumors claiming that a Sony State of Play showcase will be happening soon, where Wolverine might get a spotlight. Of course, all rumors should be taken with a grain of salt, but a 2026 release date isn't beyond the realm of possibility.

How Magic: The Gathering's Own 2026 Plans Could Coincide

While Marvel already has a busy year set for 2026with Avengers: Doomsday and Spider-Man: Brand New Day already on the docket Wolverine would by no means be lost in the shuffle, given the hype surrounding the character and Insomniac's previous Spider-Man projects. Considering this, Magic: The Gathering 's 2026 sets could snatch an opportunity.

Marvel and Magic are having an increasingly successful relationship, a byproduct of Wizards of the Coast's recent pursuit of more and more crossovers, and this will continue into 2026 with another Universes Beyond set. Furthermore, though this has yet to be revealed, head designer on Magic: The Gathering , Mark Rosewater, has expressed that Wizards wanted to reprint the Marvel cards from last year's Secret Lair drop in 2025, but that the company has settled on merging these reprints with an upcoming 2026 set.

When it comes to those Marvel Secret Lair cards, Wolverine had his own dedicated drop. Not only did he get a dedicated card, but his drop brought 4 related cards along in tandem, all themed around the character. Combining the possibility of this drop being reprinted with the Marvel Universes Beyond set coming in 2026, which will likely synergize with Doomsday (which will lean heavily on the X-Men cast of heroes and villains), MTG has a huge chance to capitalize on a new wave of hype around Wolverine. The game is all set to give the character a special spotlight and cash in, should a 2026 Marvel's Wolverine truly be on the cards.

Accepting, for the moment, the chance of Marvel's Wolverine getting a 2026 release date, this timeline would see the game find itself in good company. Not only will Doomsday relate hugely to the X-Men characters, but MTG is already lined up to score fans some more Wolverine cardsand it'd be worth it for WOTC to lean in even more. The year will bring a great deal of attention to Wolverine if all these dominoes fall into place, who's already a character with more attention than most. Despite the MCU taking center stage for the past decade, Wolverine has remained one of the most popular superheroes of all time. With how much buzz MTG 's crossover sets receive, there's potential for an incredibly lucrative crossover if rumors prove true.

Marvel's Wolverine

item.title: Best Video Game Leaders
item.description:
Summary

  • Video games shine with charismatic leaders who inspire squads or embody player power fantasies.
  • Charisma can build loyalty or spiral into a tragic downfall, making leaders compelling and unpredictable.
  • From noble saviors to cultists and tyrants, these leaders define stories and deliver unforgettable moments.

Video games are rife with charismatic figures that are a joy to interact with. Sometimes, these characters end up being the player, which makes for a fun power fantasy.

Other times, players interact closely with a leader who rallies the pack and is someone people can get behind. While this may work out in most instances, there are times when these leaders experience a downfall that is either tragic or cathartic to witness, based on their personality.

Commander Shepard

Leads A Squad Of Competent Soldiers To Save The Galaxy Time And Time Again

Mass Effect: Legendary Edition
9 /10
14
9.7 /10
Released
May 14, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Drug Reference, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Alcohol, Violence
Powered by

The original Mass Effect trilogy run is GOATed because of the protagonist. Commander Shepard can be molded into whatever image players wish, but their magnetic charisma never dies.

Their no-nonsense attitude doesn't strip them of a personality, and their capable attitude ensures that squadmates will rally behind their cause. Whether Shepard is a benevolent or cruel squad leader is up to the player, but he can always convince people to follow his cause with his strong words and impactful actions.

Dutch van der Linde

Until Hosea Was Alive, His Leadership And Charisma Helped The Camp Stick Together

Red Dead Redemption 2
10 /10
172
9.5 /10
Released
October 26, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

Dutch's plan was easy to believe at first, even if the Blackwater heist had gone south. Thankfully, after holing up for a few days in Colter during a storm, they reach Horseshoe Overlook, and Dutch gets a lot of time to shine as a charismatic leader. He can inspire people with mere words and has a group so loyal that they have no problem drawing their guns when the Pinkertons come knocking.

However, after Hosea's death, Dutch loses his way. Perhaps he always did after the botched Blackwater job, but Arthur and John realize that Dutch is far from the man they knew. His downfall as a leader is cemented in the first Red Dead Redemption , when John hunts down his former leader and guns him down.

Elisabet Sobeck

Took Precautionary Measures So That The Faro Plague Wouldn't Decimate The Entire Population

Horizon Zero Dawn
Adventure
RPG
Systems
Released
February 28, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen - Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Mild Sexual Themes, Violence
Powered by

Horizon Zero Dawn is a great debut title that introduces one of the most compelling worlds in a video game. The mystery behind this apocalypse is what drives players to explore the world and go through the story, hoping to find some clues along the way.

Elisabet Sobeck is the gifted scientist who led Project Zero Dawn to ensure that humanity could bounce back after the Faro Plague. She was a sympathetic and altruistic leader who did everything she could to save her race and undo Ted Faro's mistakes.

Saskia The Dragonslayer

A Leader Who Can Guide Upper Aedirn To Prosperity

The Witcher 2
9 /10
7.8 /10
Released
May 17, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Saskia is a powerful warrior who led the rebellion of Upper Aedirn during the events of The Witcher 2 . However, it turns out that she's a dragon, something Geralt learns most painfully. She fabricated a backstory with Iorveth and uses her legend of slaying a dragon to attract a large number of followers from various races. It's clear that she was a powerful, charismatic leader, given the support she generated in no time.

Depending on how the Battle of Vergen plays out, she can become an independent ruler in this realm. Fans of the books will be delighted to know that her father is none other than Villentretenmerth, also known as Borch Three Jackdaws in his human form.

Joseph Seed

A Charismatic Cult Leader With Many Mindless Followers

Far Cry 5
9 /10
22
7.9 /10
Released
March 27, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

The Far Cry series is full of challenging leaders who are a joy to interact with, and many people find Joseph Seed to be the most riveting of the lot. Unlike Vaas, he's around till the end, and he makes far more of an impact than Pagan Min as an antagonist.

Even after taking out his family and arresting him, Joseph Seed has the final laugh. His followers were clearly devoted to him on a disturbing level, and the fact that he could launch a nuke to obliterate Hope County is a testament to just how much power and influence he wielded.

Shao Kahn

Leads The Netherrealm With An Iron Fist

Mortal Kombat 1
8 /10
31
8.5 /10
Released
September 19, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

Mortal Kombat is full of iconic characters, and Shao Kahn is no exception. This character is a brutal emperor who has no remorse for his enemies and is notorious for being the hardest challenge to conquer in every Mortal Kombat game. Unlike most other leaders, Shao Kahn demands respect from his subjects and doesn't tolerate any form of insubordination, using his power to prove time and time again why he's fit to be a leader.

Seeing Shao Kahn lay waste to some of Earthrealm's strongest fighters makes it clear why this villain is feared by many. He's a monster in every sense of the word, and players usually rely on cheap strategies or exploits to take down this brutal emperor.

Senator Steven Armstrong

Has Ambitions To Become The Next President Of The United States

Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance
8 /10
8.8 /10
Released
February 19, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

Armstrong is one of the greatest villains in video game history. His presence alone turned Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance into one of the most memorable video games of all time, with this Senator boasting lofty ambitions to become the next President of the United States. The way this powerful political figure used war to enact his goals makes him the perfect depiction of a corrupt, deluded politician who believes that the end justifies the means.

He embodies the chaotic charisma of a classic Kojima villain, with the scene of him showing off his nanomachine-enhanced body becoming a meme for obvious reasons. As challenging a boss as he may be, players will love overcoming his might after numerous failed attempts.

General Ketheric Thorm

An Undead Leader Of The Cult Of The Absolute With A Tragic Backstory

Baldur's Gate 3
9 /10
142
9.7 /10
Released
August 3, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Act 2 of Baldur's Gate 3 is arguably where the game peaks, with players finally getting to see the Shadow Curse firsthand. The antagonist of this arc is also one of the greatest video game villains, who must be defeated to save the Shadow-Cursed Lands. A ruthless, relentless leader who is a perfect fit to lead an undead army that only respects power, there's more to this captivating villain than what meets the eye.

Voiced by J.K. Simmons, General Ketheric Thorm is a character both intimidating and tragic in equal measure. His death may be necessary, but it is something that fans will be deeply affected by, especially after seeing that the villains of Act 3 don't hold a candle to this amazing antagonist.

item.title: A Gentlemen's Dispute - Official Launch Trailer
item.description: Take a look at the official launch trailer for A Gentlemen's Dispute, a comedic party brawler developed by Blast Furnace Games.
